page.title: 12Scouting at Hulton Park
page.content: In l959 Sir Geoffrey Hulton leased 27 acres of Hulton Park to Bolton Scout Association. The land was derelict and overgrown but in l961 a start was made to create a scout camp. 26 years later the area is more open and a canteen,bunk house,sick bay and warden's office have been built on the site of the old hall. There is a special hut for handicapped campers. The lake at the rear of the hall has been cleared of debris and is used for water sports. Scouts from all over the country camp here. The local Guides are celebrating 75 years of Guiding with a special camp in August l985. Wild life has returned to the park in abundance and no attempt is made to eradicate any species; even rabbits which nibble young trees are tolerated & the cellars of the old hall make an excellent sett for a badger family!
